channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpath is overgrown with brambles, 25th July
item.description:
The footpath which in 6 weeks will be used by students of 2 large secondary schools and a primary school is overgrown with brambles & stinging nettles. Forcing pedestrians into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawksbrook Lane, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DULWICH heritage fingerpost missing direction fingers, 25th July
item.description:
The fingerpost at the junction of Eynella Road and Court Lane SE21 has lost two wooden fingers which need replacing. A resident has found the fingers discarded and is keeping them safe. Please contact originator of this post to recover them. They will need refixing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Lane, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of a 3 seater sofa and other furniture has been dumped outside of the entrance gates of the Thames Water pumping station which requires removing, and the bushes here need to be cut back, 25th July
item.description:
Fly tipping of a 3 seater sofa and other furniture has been dumped outside of the entrance gates of the Thames Water pumping station which requires removing, and the bushes here need to be cut back as this is obstructing the pavement- resident is going to send in photos to send to Footscraydirect@bexley.gov.uk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollywood Way, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Local residents have no respect, 25th July
item.description:
The family live at 45 Mayfield Road. They’ve been at the park vandalising it, making it hard for other people to play and now leaving their rubbish everywhere. When you confront them you get verbally abused by the mother and children. Yet again more SafeHomes/Bexley Homes that have no respect.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement needs to be dug up to repair my side fence, 25th July
item.description:
To repair my side fence which is in St Blaise Avenue the builder needs to dig up some of the footpath so needs authorisation. Tried phoning but unable to reach correct department. My builder is David Paris email : parisfencing@gmail.com Tel: 07958704203 Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harwood Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
